word:
Wherever this message [present truth] comes its fruits are good. A vigor and a vital energy are brought into the church, and where the message is accepted, there hope and courage and faith beam in the countenances of all those who open their eyes to see, their understanding to perceive and their hearts to receive the great treasure of truth.--Manuscript 24, 1888, pp. 16-21, 24,25. ("Looking Back at Minneapolis," cir. November or December, 1888.) 

White Estate Washington, D. C. January 22, 1980
